channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Google Launches Same-Day Delivery Service in San Francisco — Design News 03.29.13
item.description:
In an attempt to compete with Amazon, Google launched same-day delivery service in San Francisco yesterday. The web giant is partnering with retailers like Toys R Us, Office Depot, and Target to court small to mid-sized businesses and families with kids. The service is free for 6 months, but will be fee-based after that.

In other news, Design Milk gets a redesign, and an there's an app for being happier. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: The Best Outdoor String Lights To Light Up the Backyard, Patio, or Balcony
item.description: I used to buy outdoor light strings at Smith & Hawken and Martha Stewart, but Smith & Hawken's only licensed through Target now and Martha Stewart no longer makes the versions I liked, so I've begun to look elsewhere and round out my source list. With LED bulbs and solar-powered lights becoming more accessible and online retailers like Amazon and Lamps Plus stocking huge inventories, there's actually a ton of good options out there. More
item.author: Maxwell Ryan

item.title: SPONSORED POST: Spring Cleaning for HomebodiesA 30 Day Challenge
item.description: March may have been about your bedroom, but we challenge you to make April about your body. If you're more Etsy than Ikea, join us for DIY Health, a joint production of Social Workout and Greatist. For 30 days, with two simple daily practices, we're aiming for total mind-body makeover. Down with treadmills! Up with home-cooked meals! We've got massive group support, and very attractive prizes from BluePrint and Bulu Box. Spring is in the air. Time to increase your personal thread count. Join us!
item.author: Sponsored Post

item.title: 10 Tech Themed Fabric Prints for DIY Projects
item.description:
If the bed or sofa is a blank canvas, it's the pillows I consider the paint. Throw pillows are an easy way to give your most cozy spaces a little more of your own personality. And if your personality is a self-proclaimed geek, techie, blogger, photographer, voracious e-reader, or smartphone addict? Well then, these are the prints for you to use in your next fabric or uplohstery DIY project. 

More
item.author: Taryn Fiol

item.title: 10 Apps to Ease the Taxing Act of Filing Your Taxes — Tablet App Recommendations
item.description:
If you're like me and haven't yet filed your 2012 US income tax return, this is probably a good time to start before the April 15 deadline arrives. In service of helping you to do just that, as well be better prepared for next year, here are several iPad, Android, and Windows 8 tablet apps to assist you in filing your taxes and getting your money organised. 

More
item.author: Joelle Alcaidinho

item.title: Before and After: Bri Emery's Living Room Makeover — Design Love Fest
item.description:
Bri Emery of Design Love Fest partnered up with her friend Emily Henderson and went for a full-on living room makeover extravaganza. Follow me after the jump to see the stunning change...
More
item.author: Alysha Findley

item.title: How To Repair Polycarbonate Plastics? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I have three La Boheme stools from Kartell. They are made of polycarbonate (like the Ghost chairs), and two of them are broken. They have cracks running along the top rim of the seat, so they can no longer bear weight without doing more damage to the chair. Does anyone have any ideas on repairing them to make them usable chairs again?

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: 3 Audiophile Turntables For 3 Different Budgets
item.description:
Perhaps as backlash against the impersonal quality of the 1's and 0's of digital music, vinyl records have been making a come back amongst music lovers searching for the warmth of analog sound. But if you're buying a record player, since it's a mechanical device, you'll most benefit by looking for models which provide stability and clean smooth rotation of the platter. I've chosen 3 turntables, all provide a quality playback experience, alongside a level of precision mechanics to please both the audiophile and those willing to spend a little more for superior sound...

More
item.author: Vahan Baladouni

item.title: Pay It Forward: Make 5 Gifts, Pass 'Em On
item.description:
A few weeks ago on Facebook, one of my pals posted a a cool idea. She said, "I'll make gifts for the first five people who respond. The only catch is that you have to make gifts for five friends too." Not surprisingly, that list filled up fast, as did the ones that followed. Since traditional gift-giving holidays are far away, this is a fab way to bring a smile to someone's face right now.

More
item.author: AnnaMaria Stephens

item.title: Kids' Gear: Bloom Dresser, Mobiles & Stroller — The Friday MORNING Scavenger
item.description:
The clock is ticking on your pregnancy. Do you have everything you need?
  • Boston, MA: Bloom Baby Dresser - $850
  • Queens, NY: Crochet Mobiles - $20
  • Boston, MA: Orbit Baby G2 Stroller - $925
  • Los Angeles, CA: Floral Rug - $300
  • New York, NY: Glider Chair & Ottoman - $350
    More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Bon Voyage, Clutter: Organizing with Suitcases
item.description:
This luggage has functional storage with vintage style. No longer practical for jet-setters, old world suitcases can have second lives as handsome sources of storage for the home. Their easy portability makes them especially handy for things that need to be moved from one room to another, like toys, craft supplies and magazines.

More
item.author: Angie Cho

item.title: Why Panna Cotta is the Perfect Dessert
item.description:
Panna cotta can always be the right dessert — whether you're throwing a fancy party or a small one, have lots of time or no time, are gluten-free, dairy-free, allergy-prone, vegan, or simply craving a delicious and creamy sweet. 

• Panna Cotta 
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: 10 Sources for Organic Modern Designs
item.description:
It's so great to see that more and more modern designs are also sustainable and eco-friendly. These ten shops, a mix of brick and mortar and online, are great resources for these organic modern designs.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Wonderful with White Walls: Houseplants — Renter Solutions
item.description:
Whether you're not allowed to paint your walls or you just prefer a white backdrop, houseplants are a happy, portable, and landlord-friendly way to inject life and color into your home. 

More
item.author: Kim Rinehimer

item.title: Arjen's Dutch Curiosity Kitchen
item.description:
Architect Arjen lives with his family in a little corner of Amsterdam. Their kitchen is typical Dutch style, with two walls of parallel kitchen units, divided by a narrow passage, which opens into a wider dining and social area...

• Arjen's Dutch Kitchen
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Cabin, Take Me Away: Mountain Inspiration for Modern Homes
item.description: I’ve lived in major cities for the past 18 years, but lately I’ve been craving a cabin in nearby Sonoma, where I fantasize I would paint and sew. This place, featured on Refinery29 this week, inspired me to look at our house tours with that modern mountain vibe. More
item.author: Theresa Gonzalez

item.title: Jonah & Jodie's "Enchanted Cottage" in Laurel Canyon — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Jodie Livingston, Documentary Filmmaker, and Jonah Adler, Consumer Product Entrepreneur and CEO of Noteworthy
Location: Laurel Canyon, Los Angeles, California
Size: 1,800 square feet
Years lived in: 2.5 years

Laurel Canyon has been immortalized as the one-time home of musicians like Frank Zappa, Jim Morrison, and Joni Mitchell, and this neighborhood in the Hollywood Hills is still a bohemian locale where lots of artists live. Jonah and Jodie have created a perfect balance by mixing in a more glamorous Hollywood aesthetic and modern art, but still appreciating the enchanting look of their canyon home.

More
item.author: Marcia Prentice

item.title: Wall Color Ideas with Dark Kitchen Cabinets? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I'm so excited to be moving into my first apartment soon! Although some of the appliances are outdated and the counter space is limited, I think I can work with the kitchen. I'm stuck on what to do with the dark cabinets, though. My landlord has agreed to let me paint the walls (but not the cabinets), and I'm thinking that that might be the quickest and most cost-effective solution for improving the space. What are your suggestions for paint colors? Any other ideas for how to brighten and update the kitchen are greatly appreciated!

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Don't-Miss Beautiful Bedrooms: Week Four — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Here we are in the final week of the My Bedroom Retreat contest and we're still reeling from all the amazing rooms we've seen. We've posted so many gorgeous bedrooms to the site in the past week that you might have missed a few. Check out this roundup of a few of the week's new entries and be sure to dig back in and revisit all the inspiring bedrooms. 

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Last-Minute Easter Egg Decorating Idea — A Daily Something
item.description:
If you haven't gotten around to getting Easter egg dye for the weekend, try this simple solution from Rebecca at A Daily Something for beautifully decorated eggs — which you can do the same day!

More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: Twin Beds Styled for All Ages
item.description:
The prettiest, most grown-up bed I've ever slept in was a twin. I was 21 and not really a pink person, but I loved that bed upholstered in a rich rose linen. While twin beds otherwise make me think of little kids, the moral of the pink bed story is that a well-styled twin can maximize space without looking juvenile.

More
item.author: Kim Rinehimer

item.title: Creating Nurseries Out of Closets — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Here's an equation you don't learn in math class: new baby + small apartment = creative thinking. Here are five nurseries that just prove: a) the majority of us own way too many clothes if we have closets this big; and b) babies really don't need that much space.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Five Inviting DIY Doghouses
item.description:
Spring has sprung (or so the calendar says), which makes it the perfect time to head outdoors and tackle those projects you've been planning all winter. My list is long — filled with landscaping and gardening projects galore — and now I can add another to my list: a modern dog abode to shelter my four-legged kids from the hot summer sun. Here are five DIY doghouses that can easily be modified to fit your own needs.

More
item.author: Kimber Watson

item.title: Get This Tech Look: Complementing the H&M Spring Outfit — Technologist Style
item.description:
Although it’s not exactly beach season quite yet, we’re getting there. Feeling inspired to embrace the tropics but still not ready to pull on the shorts yet, I looked to this fun outfit from H&M’s spring 2013 look book. The textured jacket and patterned jeans in soft white hint at the warmer weather to come while the pineapple t-shirt fully embraces it. Here’s equally fun and quirky tech and accessories to match this outfit. 


More
item.author: Julienne Lin

item.title: Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: Drywall is Happening — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Name: Claire & Jeffrey
Type of Project: Kitchen remodel
Location: Minneapolis, Minnesota
Type of building: Single-family bungalow, 950 square feet

The Renovation Diaries are a new collaboration with our community in which we feature your step by step renovation progress and provide monetary support towards getting it done in style. See all of our Reno Diaries here.

DRYWALL IS HAPPENING! Finally, some exciting, transformative, visual progress. The space is feeling bright and wide-open. 

More
item.author: Guest
